Method Detail

initResourceSet

public static void initResourceSet(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet resourceSet)
Initializes the resource factory registry and the package registry of the given resource set with some common values for stand alone usage.

It registers

  • the default file extension '*' and the default content type identifier '*' to an XMI resource factory,
  • the file extension .ecore and the content type identifier org.eclipse.emf.ecore to an Ecore resource factory
  • and the file extension .emof and the content type identifier org.eclipse.emf.emof to an EMOF resource factory.

It also registers the Ecore package in the package registry of the given resource set (useful if this registry is not delegating to the global registry ).

Parameters:
resourceSet - the resource set to initialize
Since:
0.1.0

reloadEPackagesFrom

public static void reloadEPackagesFrom(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.Resource ecoreResource)
Searches and unregisters all the EPackages from the given ecoreResource in the package registry of its owning resource set and from the global registry. It then registers all the EPackages in the resource set registry only.

Note that if you change the namespace URI of one this EPackage, the reload will simply register it and let the old one in the registry. This may have unexpected side-effects.

Parameters:
ecoreResource - the resource to search in (expected to contain EPackages).
Since:
0.1.0

getModelsFrom

public static java.util.List<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.Resource> getModelsFrom(java.io.File directory,
                                                                                    org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet resourceSet)
Loads the models contained by the given directory in the given ResourceSet.

If resourceSet is null, all models will be loaded in a new resourceSet.

Parameters:
directory - The directory from which to load the models.
resourceSet - The ResourceSet to load the model in. If null, all models will be loaded in a new resourceSet.
Returns:
The models contained by the given directory.

getModelsFrom

public static java.util.List<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.Resource> getModelsFrom(java.io.File directory,
                                                                                    java.lang.String extension,
                                                                                    org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet resourceSet)
Loads the files with the given extension contained by the given directory as EObjects in the given ResourceSet.

If resourceSet is null, all models will be loaded in a new resourceSet.

The argument extension is in fact the needed suffix for its name in order for a file to be loaded. If it is equal to "rd", a file named "model.aird" will be loaded, but so would be a file named "Shepherd".

The empty String or null will result in all the files of the given directory to be loaded, and would then be equivalent to getModelsFrom(File, ResourceSet).

Parameters:
directory - The directory from which to load the models.
extension - File extension of the files to load. If null, will consider all extensions.
resourceSet - The ResourceSet to load the model in. If null, all models will be loaded in a new resourceSet.
Returns:
The models contained by the given directory.

load

public static org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.Resource load(java.io.File file,
                                                           org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet resourceSet)
Loads a model from a File in a given ResourceSet.

This will return the resource of the loaded model.

Parameters:
file - File containing the model to be loaded.
resourceSet - The ResourceSet to load the model in.
Returns:
The model loaded from the file.

load

public static org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.Resource load(java.io.InputStream stream,
                                                           java.lang.String fileName,
                                                           org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet resourceSet)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
Load a model from an InputStream in a given ResourceSet.

This will return the resource of the loaded model.

Parameters:
stream - The inputstream to load from
fileName - The original filename
resourceSet - The ResourceSet to load the model in.
Returns:
The loaded model
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the given file does not exist.

load

public static org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.Resource load(java.lang.String path,
                                                           org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet resourceSet)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
Loads a model from the String representing the location of a model.

This can be called with pathes of the form

  • /pluginID/path
  • platform:/plugin/pluginID/path
  • platform:/resource/pluginID/path

This will return the resource of the loaded model.

Parameters:
path - Location of the model.
resourceSet - The ResourceSet to load the model in.
Returns:
The model loaded from the path.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the path doesn't resolve to a reachable location.

public static org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.Resource load(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI modelURI,
                                                           org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.ResourceSet resourceSet)
Loads a model from an URI in a given ResourceSet.

This will return the resource of the loaded model.

Parameters:

resourceSet - The ResourceSet to load the model in.
Returns:
The model loaded from the URI.
